intro: Purpusia saxosa, commonly known as the saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually succulent and arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps it retain moisture in its often arid habitat. Purpusia saxosa thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
